intro: Lamyra alata, commonly known as the winged lamyra, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Lamyra alata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
